result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Brandenburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant David J Brandenburg in court with attorney Gerald J. Hersil.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called 1:02pm - 16CF12 & 15CF212 called - 15CF212 DRI - 16CF12 Count 2 DRI - Plea No contest to count 1 in 16CF12 - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Hersil/Court to sentencing - 1 year jail with huber Lincoln County Jail concurrent to Federal case 16CR67 - To begin service on or before 4/7/17 - Defendant advised of Voting rights/Firearm possession - Balance of bond continued until prison sentence commences - Post conviction rights given

Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF212 & 16CF12 - Statements by Dunphy - Defendant has reached an agreement with Federal Court - It will be a fews months before he returns for sentencing - Mandatory minimum sentence is 10 years in  prison - These cases to be set for PSC -  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Gerald J. Hersil appeared.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 16CF12 & 15CF212 - Arguments by Hersil regarding bail modification - Arguments by Dunphy - Is living in South Carolina, wants to be able to operate a motor vehicle for employment and medical appointments - Attorney Hersil believes he is "still looking" for employment - Court modifies bond to - May operate a motor vehicle to attend medical appointments and for employment purposes - Defendant must have a valid drivers licensed to operate -
